results.adx_keywords: Divorce, Separations and Annulments;Football;Fashion and Apparel;Celebrities;Brady, Tom;Bundchen, Gisele;Tampa Bay Buccaneers
results.byline: By Jesus Jiménez and Kevin Draper
results.title: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen Divorce After 13 Years
results.abstract: The closely watched celebrity couple announced their split on Instagram and filed their divorce agreement in a Florida court.

media.caption: Gisele Bündchen and Tom Brady after the Super Bowl in February 2021, which Brady won with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Rumors and Misinformation;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Fringe Groups and Movements;Threats and Threatening Messages;Pelosi, Nancy;Pelosi, Paul
results.title: Pelosi Attack Highlights Rising Fears of Political Violence
results.abstract: The assault of the House speaker’s husband inside their home comes as threats against members of Congress have increased in recent years.

media.caption: Security personnel standing guard while Representative Steve Scalise, Republican of Louisiana, was speaking on the steps of the Capitol last year. Mr. Scalise was shot in 2017 by a man with a grudge against Republicans.

results.adx_keywords: Landslides and Mudslides;Floods;Deaths (Fatalities);Hurricanes and Tropical Storms;Rain;Philippines;Maguindanao (Philippines)
results.byline: By Jason Gutierrez and John Yoon
results.title: At Least 45 Dead as Flooding and Landslides Hit the Philippines
results.abstract: Severe Tropical Storm Nalgae made landfall early Saturday and was expected to continue bringing strong winds and torrential rain to large areas of the country through the weekend.

media.caption: The aftermath of a landslide, which was set off by the heavy rains of Nalgae, on Friday in the town of Parang in the Philippines.
media.copyright: Philippines Marines Battalion Landing Team 5, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Service;Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV);Children and Childhood;Babies and Infants;Hospitals;Immune System;Viruses;Disease Rates;Coughs
results.title: R.S.V. Cases Are Rising. Here’s What You Need to Know
results.abstract: Before the Covid pandemic, most people caught respiratory syncytial virus before the age of 2. Now things have changed.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Schumer, Charles E;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Democratic Party
results.title: Schumer Caught on Mic Forecasting Democrats’ Midterm Races
results.abstract: Relief at John Fetterman’s debate and the Pennsylvania Senate race, alarm at Herschel Walker’s standing in Georgia.

media.caption: Senator Chuck Schumer and President Biden met at the Syracuse airport on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Pop and Rock Music;Country Music;Lewis, Jerry Lee
results.title: Jerry Lee Lewis, a Rock ’n’ Roll Original, Dies at 87
results.abstract: With his pounding piano, his impassioned vocals and his incendiary performing style, Mr. Lewis lived up to his nickname, the Killer.

media.caption: Jerry Lee Lewis in 1957. His incendiary performing style captured the essence of rock rebellion.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Capitol Building (Washington, DC);Riley, Michael A (US Capitol Police Officer);United States Capitol Police
results.title: Ex-Capitol Police Officer Found Guilty of Obstruction in Jan. 6 Case
results.abstract: A jury found that the man, Michael A. Riley, 51, had deleted Facebook messages in which he offered advice to a Jan. 6 rioter about how to avoid getting caught, prosecutors said.
per_facet: Riley, Michael A (US Capitol Police Officer)

media.caption: Officer Michael Riley outside Capitol Police headquarters after being named Officer of the Month for February 2011 by the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund. He was convicted Friday of obstruction of justice in connection with the Jan. 6 riot.
media.copyright: Tom Williams/Roll Call, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Documentary Films and Programs;Television;Movies;News and News Media;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Budgets and Budgeting;Licht, Christopher A (1971- );CNN;Warner Bros Discovery
results.title: CNN Cuts Back on Original Series and Films
results.abstract: Acquired and commissioned documentary movies and TV shows like ‘Navalny’ and ‘Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy’ are going away.

media.caption: CNN is getting rid of original shows like ‘Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy.’

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;Embezzlement;Money Laundering;Decisions and Verdicts;Border Barriers;Shea, Timothy A;Bannon, Stephen K;Kolfage, Brian;Badolato, Andrew;Trump, Donald J;We Build the Wall
results.title: In Retrial, Man Who Helped Run Border Wall Charity Is Convicted
results.abstract: Timothy Shea was the only one of four defendants in the federal case to face a jury. The former Trump adviser Stephen K. Bannon faces similar charges in state court.

media.caption: Timothy Shea was a central figure in raising $25 million for a barrier separating the United States from Mexico.

results.adx_keywords: Terrorism;Detainees;September 11 (2001);Deaths (Obituaries);Saifullah Paracha;Guantanamo Bay Naval Base (Cuba);Pakistan
results.title: U.S. Releases Guantánamo’s Oldest Prisoner
results.abstract: Saifullah Paracha, 75, was accused of being a Qaeda sympathizer and was held for two decades. But he was never charged with a crime.

media.caption: Saifullah Paracha on Saturday at a McDonald’s in Karachi, Pakistan.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;Absentee Voting;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Conspiracy Theories;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Decisions and Verdicts;Jennings, Melody;Liburdi, Michael T;Clean Elections USA;Maricopa County (Ariz)
results.title: Federal Judge Allows Activists to Stake Out Ballot Boxes in Arizona
results.abstract: Judge Michael T. Liburdi said activists have a First Amendment right to gather around ballot boxes in the state. Voting rights groups called the tactic voter intimidation.

media.caption: A photo provided by the Maricopa County Elections Department shows two armed individuals at the site of a ballot drop box in Mesa, Ariz., last week.

results.adx_keywords: Assaults;Pelosi, Paul;Pelosi, Nancy;House of Representatives;San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: What We Know About the Attack on Nancy Pelosi’s Husband
results.abstract: Paul Pelosi, 82, underwent surgery for a skull fracture after he was assaulted at the couple’s home in San Francisco, and was expected to recover, a spokesman for Ms. Pelosi said.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Ryan, Timothy J (1973- );Vance, J D;Brown, Sherrod;Greene, Marjorie Taylor (1974- );McDaniel, Ronna Romney;Thiel, Peter A;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Ohio
results.title: In Ohio, G.O.P. Sees a Clean Victory as Democrats Predict an Upset
results.abstract: Polls show Representative Tim Ryan competing within the margin of error against his Republican opponent, J.D. Vance, in the high-profile Ohio Senate race.

media.caption: Tim Ryan speaking to supporters at the United Auto Workers’ Local 14 in Toledo, Ohio.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Drones (Pilotless Planes);Defense and Military Forces;Putin, Vladimir V;Kherson (Ukraine);Crimea (Ukraine);Dnipro (Ukraine);Sevastopol (Ukraine);Ukraine;Russia
results.title: With Western Weapons, Ukraine Is Turning the Tables in an Artillery War
results.abstract: In the southern Kherson region, Ukraine now has the advantage in range and precision guidance of artillery, rockets and drones, erasing what had been a critical Russian asset.

media.caption: A team of Ukrainian soldiers armed a drone with bombs on Friday during a mission that destroyed a Russian armored personnel carrier on the front lines in the country’s southern Kherson region.
media.copyright: Finbarr O’Reilly for The New York Times

results.byline: By Vimal Patel and Johnny Diaz
results.title: 8 People Found After Oklahoma House Fire Died in Murder-Suicide, Police Say
results.abstract: Two adults and six children, believed to be members of the same family, were found dead in a home near Tulsa, the police said.

media.caption: Police officers and firefighters at a house fire in Broken Arrow, Okla. where eight people were found dead.
media.copyright: Ian Maule/Tulsa World, via Associated Press

results.title: The Pelosis and a Haunted America

media.caption: Nancy and Paul Pelosi in 1987. They have been married for 59 years.

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Television;Colbert, Stephen;Fallon, Jimmy;Noah, Trevor (1984- )
results.title: Stephen Colbert Bans Kanye West From ‘The Late Show’
results.abstract: Colbert said his jurisdiction extended into the northern half of Times Square, and that he was “banning Kanye from coming north of Bubba Gump Shrimp.”

media.caption: “I have no excuses for why I didn’t do this before, except that he has never been on the show, had no plans to be on the show, we have never asked him to be on the show, and I’m not sure he’s aware that I have a show,” Stephen Colbert said.

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Senate;Black People;Voting and Voters;Polls and Public Opinion;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Fetterman, John (1969- );Oz, Mehmet C;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Pennsylvania;Philadelphia (Pa)
results.title: Oz Struggles to Woo Black Philadelphians in Senate Race
results.abstract: Dr. Mehmet Oz has been trying to reach Black voters in Pennsylvania’s most Democratic city as he runs for the Senate.

media.caption: Dr. Mehmet Oz’s crime policy pitch in his race against John Fetterman includes supporting community policing, ending “sanctuary cities” and stopping fentanyl at the Southwest border.
media.copyright: Hannah Beier for The New York Times

results.title: Here’s What to Know About Brazil’s Runoff Election
results.abstract: The vote comes after a long and ugly campaign that pits two major political figures against each other in race that has tested the country’s democracy.

media.caption: Voting in the first round of presidential elections earlier this month in São Paulo.

results.adx_keywords: Native Americans;Academy Awards (Oscars);Indigenous People;Apache Indians;Brando, Marlon;Keeler, Jacqueline;Littlefeather, Sacheen;Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences;San Francisco Chronicle
results.byline: By Eduardo Medina and Michael Levenson
results.title: Sacheen Littlefeather and the Question of Native Identity
results.abstract: The actress, who died Oct. 2, became famous for a protest at the 1973 Oscars. Now a researcher and Littlefeather’s own sisters dispute her claims that she was Native American. Her defenders say Indian identity is a complex matter.
org_facet: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences

media.caption: Sacheen Littlefeather at an event in September in her honor at the Academy Museum in Los Angeles. She was joined by Bird Runningwater, the co-chairman of the Academy’s Indigenous Alliance.
